etymologies: late 19th century. From poly- + ancient Greek -δυμ- (in δίδυμος twin) + -ite, after German Polydymit

definitions: A mineral of the cubic system that is a sulphide of nickel, Ni₃ S₄, occurs as grey, metallic masses of polysynthetic twin crystals, and is an endmember of a series with linnaeite.
